instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4668: What is 820-4668? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
Arrived with damaged lcd connector and cable from previous idiot. After replacing LCD connector and cable I still do not get anything on the internal LCD.

External works but there are lines next to the ? folder (see picture)

What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
Maybe RAM, or CPU issue, as there is no dedicated GPU.

If nothing appears on internal LCD, then DP video output could be damaged from previous repair attempt.
Check diode mode al data lines from LCD connector.
Be sure no moved, or knocked off components there.
Also check all traces continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
diode mode lcd connector  pin 1-6 .471  pin 13 .670  pin 14 .680 pin 15 .985 pin 16 .989  pin 17 .754  pin 18 .901 pin 20 .712 pin 21 .712  pin 23 0L pin 24 OL pin 26 OL pin 27 OL

since pin 24-27 are 0L could <CAPACITOR>C4500</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C4503</CAPACITOR> be bad? Pin 2 on <CAPACITOR>C4500</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C4503</CAPACITOR> are all 0.422 but pad 1 are all 0L

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
Hopeless project.
Eeven if you will get picture on internal LCD, image will still be bad; same as on external monitor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message: What makes it a hopeless project? There isn?t any visible board damage whatsoever. Only the internal connector itself was messed up when it arrived. Pads are all good and have continuity with new connector. Could <CHIP>U4500</CHIP> have anything to do with it??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4668</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no screen
threads.message:
This board doesn't have a dedicated GPU.
You get a bad image on external monitor.
Solving internal LCD problem, will not solve the image aspect...
